The Giants placed reliever Sam Coonrod on the 10-day injured list Friday and recalled left-hander Sam Selman from the alternate camp in Sacramento.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Khris Davis is absent from the @Athletics lineup for a second straight game as they open a four-game series against the Mariners in Seattle tonight. 

@MatthewLawahara has more on lineup vs. right-hander Taijuwan Walker: https://t.co/hPuInx5SE6

text: “People are funny because right now, they really don’t want to be told what to do. I don’t want to have be anyone’s mother. But I can’t help but worry about people.” https://t.co/skGyYvypIx

name: sfchronicle
text:
As California nears 500,000 confirmed cases today, the state caps off July as the deadliest, most infectious month since the pandemic began.

name: sfchronicle
text: “I see this as a first step toward reparations in the city,” Walton said. “Investing $120 million in the Black community is something to be excited about.  Obviously, I wish it could be more.” https://t.co/qFlhNBFzab

name: sfchronicle
text:
Pac-12 reveals details of a 10-game, conference-only football schedule:

- Season would start Sept. 26 
- Has flexibility for makeup games if pandemic forces postponements
- Cal has canceled 2020 season tickets 

Read more: https://t.co/MwWxNcg88m

name: sfchronicle
text:
S.F. officials plan to redirect $120 million over the next two years from the budgets of the police and sheriff’s departments to fund investments in the city’s Black community. 

@DominicFracassa & @MeganRCassidy have more: https://t.co/4oPRofSAkv

name: sfchronicle
text:
“They said it was my choice to sign the paper, but it wasn’t really my choice.”

As employers ask people to return, some are requiring employees to sign waivers for coronavirus risk: https://t.co/FrKWATCxyd
